alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains; East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Far Northwest Highlands; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; South Central Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southwest Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 29 at 1:37PM MST until January 01 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 6 inches at the lower elevations and 6 to 12 inches above 7500 feet. Locally higher amounts possible over the peaks and along west facing slopes. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph creating areas of reduced visibilities in blowing snow. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central, northwest, and west central New Mexico. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Some roads may be closed. Significant travel delays are possible. The hazardous conditions could impact commuters as well as holiday travelers.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
